intro: Acmella lundellii, commonly known as the yellow horned violet, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with a prominent central spur. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Acmella lundellii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
